item.title: STORYTELLING CHALLENGE: What’s your story?
item.dc:creator: Roxanne Joseph
item.description:
We challenge you to re-imagine storytelling Everyone has a story to tell. What’s yours? Do you know of a community who has a gap that needs to be filled or problem solved? What are some of the issues that matter the most to you? The way we tell stories has changed: today, journalism goes beyond […]

The post STORYTELLING CHALLENGE: What’s your story? appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.

item.title: What’s data got to do with it? We’re accepting applications for our third Data-Driven Journalism Academy. Apply, and find out…
item.dc:creator: Sarah Evans
item.description:
Applications are now open for the third cohort of Code for South Africa’s Data-Driven Journalism Academy, which kicks off on September 12.

The post What’s data got to do with it? We’re accepting applications for our third Data-Driven Journalism Academy. Apply, and find out… appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.

item.title: The Panama Papers in Africa: how tax avoidance is robbing Africa of billions
item.dc:creator: Sarah Evans
item.description:
Letitia Diergaardt is a receptionist for a battery-supplier in Windhoek, Namibia. One can almost picture her office: modest, a computer on her desk and hard copy accounting sheets, financial documents and debtors’ books neatly filed in cabinets. Diergaardt is also a director or owner of nine offshore companies in the British Virgin Islands, a tax […]

The post The Panama Papers in Africa: how tax avoidance is robbing Africa of billions appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.
